A student who can travel 100s of kilometers to study, can't just travel few kms to get signals. Students need to 
understand that no one was prepared for it. They need to move forward, their arguments are valid but this must be

conditions, then good luck with your dreams. I've seen students who have access to everything yet they complain
 that this is not the right way to teach etc etc. My point is that there are tons of free and even better resources
 available on the internet why don't you use them? On the same hand I'm deeply concerned about those who genuinely
 lack such facilities. But they should also keep in mind that they would need to tackle it one way or the other.

Assalamualaikum Respected Sir,Please let us share some facts to you... 
1. Many universities are there, whose faculty cannot provide best in the physial environment....How could they 
effectively learn from those instructors?
2. Especially, many private universities just show off the formalities for conducting online classes...but we don't think 
about the education is smoothly run at immediately...
3. Hope, you also knew about the GPA effects, politics in universities,....All of the universities are not professional at
 online like e.g. VComsats lectures.So kindly, also think about the students grades.
4. There are the cases that urgant holidays for COVID-19 virus. Instructors put the final exams marks without conduct
 any exam...So what is this.... like an unrealistic, immature behavior?
5. Please don't implement your experiences with playing students careers. How could you say this.. You are trying for
 all studetns..? And thise students, for whom compulsion to drop semesters is realistic to you?
6. The systems you mentioned in the video... You should knew about the load on those system servers, stress load, 
response time & performances, reliability etc. as software system. 
For HEC, 1. Shortly, I think this would be enough for you about your online classes. All others matter are not effectively 
share here. 
2. Be thoughtful, and do a strong critical analysis for your systems, faculty etc. 
3. Kindly, first make your education system reliable, effective, and good be able to provide knowledge and training for
 all aspects of different fields of education.
Then, talk for online classes.
Thank you
Warm Regards
Students Community

#HEC_PromoteToNextSemester 
 #SayNoToUniversitiesFees

1.Internet issue:

Mostly students are from backward areas that enjoy only 2G. Boys can go to outside to get 3G but what about girls?
Boys go outside, but there is no facilities in villages. A lot of noice, bad thinkings about the students about usage of mobile in our society disturbs the students.
Whats about battery of mobile phone while attending continuously 2,3 lectures for the students outside the village? 

2.Resources
Mostly students are from backward areas and belongs to middle class families, that have no such resources to buy mobile phones & laptops as well.So, students cannot attend classes.

3.Burden
There are too many lectures in a week (24 lec) with Saturday off. Why?
It's the month of Ramadan, month of more worship for muslims, the holy month. What you thik about Ramadan?
If we listen lectures, prepare or write them?
4 lectures in a day out of which 3 are continues. And most burden of assignments.

4.Health Disorders
Students body is also a human body! What you think about students health? 
Listening lectures or attending classes continuously using headphones disturb hearing of the body, and also damage mental rest and causes headache. 
Doctors said that continuously using mobile ?? phone is harmful to human body that's 100% true. What you think about eyesight problems of students. I hope if you continue online classes you will see 1 person out of 3 that will be the patient of eyesight, whose complete responsible will be our University. What you think about distancing of students from 'worship during Ramadan','Family members'?

5.Lecture issue
Some lectures also have voice issues.Some slides voice format is not supported by mostly mobiles. Its also a side effect of slides study that if a slide have audio of 5 minutes we cannot start fron 2nd minute, if we have some confusion in a slide then we have to start listening from beginning that losses our intention to study and causes disheartening. During lectures our phone run out of internet, after this we often not able to join the class. What's about data packages?
For notification  of announcements from teachers we have to check Google classroom again and again that's not a good thing during study and in the internet problems.
#UONStudents
#WeWantSemesterBreak

HEC itself is not sure how to cope with the situation. It seems as if HEC's information source is twitter, where students are
 tweeting whatever they are being fed by the their team heads on daily basis. Students have internet for whatsapp, twitter and
 facebook, but not for the educational purposes. What is more startling and disastrous is that HEC is actually believing whatever
 is being said on social media ignoring the fact that students are using internet for social media meaning thereby they have access to stable internet per se. HEC fails to understand the underlying premise of these trends on social media. This is not a country where students love to study, its a place where students are only interested in extracurricular activities and nothing more. 
Students whose many years have been wasted due to various reasons are more worried than ever, some are in their final years 
to apply for any further education or jobs, and this delay is fatal for them. Students who are in their final semester and have 
attempted their mid exams are only waiting for their finals. No definite policy nor any plan has been announced by HEC for 
universities and students thereof. Internet was never the problem, but the will of HEC is and always was. Govt universities 
never cared about students or anything else, private universities only care about money. No one is concerned about the so 
called future of country (the students).

Higher Education Commission (HEC) is under the order of our government, not only the schools and colleges are going through
 this pandemic situation, university students are facing the same issues. Online classes might be effective for the minor student
 community but the major portion is going through a lot of trouble, approximately 30% are understanding and learning through
 this online teaching process rest 70% is unsatisfied and in trouble. Now where the students are not even sure about the 
knowledge gathered through online sessions HEC has decided to arrange examinations (either online or sitting exams) 
when we are not prepared without even concerning our issues, how can someone attempt the exams without learning.
 Is it all about taking exams and huge fees from the students? Majority of the portion is on scholarship who will assure to 
pay their fee when they can?t maintain their grades? Moreover it?s not just about a semester, fee or scholarship it is about
 their career. How can HEC risk our career? Is there nobody to raise voice for us?  
We have signed various petition regarding no online classes and no exams for university students but no one bothered about
 it now we want media to draw government?s attention toward us. 
We demand to be promoted to next semester either on the basis of previous result or the upcoming semesters result after the 
COVID-19 .
WE DEMAND NO EXAMINATION FOR UNIVERSITY STUDENT TILL THIS COVID-19 OR PROPER REGULAR CLASSES.
Save our result save our career.
      RAISE VOICE FOR YOURSELVES!

This is not the way an educated nation should behave. This is why we are hundreds of years behind of developed countries. 
Online classes is nothing new, it has been followed for years in many countries. For entertainment purposes, for whatsapp,
 for YouTube and movies, everyone has internet, but when it comes to constructive purposes like education,  everyone has a 
problem. Education shouldn't be banned like this but it should just be improved with proper training and strict supervision of 
authorities. Online classes isn't such an issue like it has become a top trending in our country. I know students who belong to
 villages but are serious in ther studies, they have mangaed to get their wifi devices like evo etc. After this, the only thing left is 
self discipline that is, to be honest and sincere to your studies and take lectures seriously even when no one is looking at you. 
We seriously need education in every regard and our youth is just busy in banning education,  in creating riots, in protesting
 instead of getting education. Any kind of circumstances or pandemic shouldn't eradicate education from any society! Totally 
disappointed by our youth.

To, 
The vice chancellor;
Jinnah university for women karachi.
Assalamualikum,
Respected sir;
As,the deliverance of current procedure of online examination by our university,we felt deeply about our examination system as
 it is not possible to conduct exams over lms 
There are many issues that can put us in difficulty:
Firstly, lms have their own server issues because while we are conducted online classes during this process we can't take online 
classes properly & when we open lms most of the time it was hanged so because of this we can't take proper online class and we 
aren't  guaranteed about the smooth run up of our online exams, interruption may cause failure to our examination.
Secondly, the lectures weren't sufficient for our understandings and were not as according to our classroom environment so, we 
are having problems in developing  our concepts regarding it by just reading the word document or attending forums. 
Lastly, there are many personal issues with many of the students, some don't have laptop facility while other have loading shedding
 & networking issues.so, it may cause a huge hurdle if we support this online examination. Our grades will be affected & moreover 
we won't be able to appear online. We want our university to promote us to our new session as per as previous grades or GPA. 
Thankyou!

Higher Education Commission (HEC) is under the order of our government, not only the schools and colleges are going through
 this pandemic situation, university students are facing the same issues. Online classes might be effective for the minor student
 community but the major portion is going through a lot of trouble, approximately 30% are understanding and learning through
 this online teaching process rest 70% is unsatisfied and in trouble. Now where the students are not even sure about the 
knowledge gathered through online sessions HEC has decided to arrange examinations (either online or sitting exams) when 
we are not prepared without even concerning our issues, how can someone attempt the exams without learning. Is it all about 
taking exams and huge fees from the students? Majority of the portion is on scholarship who will assure to pay their fee when
 they can?t maintain their grades? Moreover it?s not just about a semester, fee or scholarship it is about their career. How can 
HEC risk our career? Is there nobody to raise voice for us?  
We have signed various petition regarding no online classes and no exams for university students but no one bothered about it 
now we want media to draw government?s attention toward us. 
We demand to be promoted to next semester either on the basis of previous result or the upcoming semesters result after the 
COVID-19 .
WE DEMAND NO EXAMINATION FOR UNIVERSITY STUDENT TILL THIS COVID-19 OR PROPER REGULAR CLASSES.
Save our result save our career.
      RAISE VOICE FOR YOURSELVES!

On Behalf of Kust Students,
We humbly request the KPK Government to provide Internet access/facility to all KUST students (e.g. providing them with 
Wi-Fi USB). Especially to those, who live in rural areas (or countryside) and cannot afford (financially) the internet facility
 installation at their home. Providing students with internet facility (e.g. Wi-Fi) will not only facilitate the online learning/classes
 in such difficult and global epidemic situation but will also help the faculties/professors (and University) in keeping the 
learning/classes on, without compromising on the quality of teaching or delivered knowledge. 
We want to beat COVID-19 by continuing our knowledge journey. We also want to encourage our students so they can continue
 to the best of their abilities under the circumstances.
Thank you,
Kohat University of Science and Technology, Kohat

Subject: We Need a Summer break rather than online Classes and Paper routine.
Respected Administration!

Sir I am a student of "Islamia University Bahawalpur" and I would like to draw your attention to the serious problem of online classes at the University. Sir online classes are making a number of problems for students, some of which are as follows:
(1) Most students belong to poor families, who do not have Android phones and laptops and cannot afford internet packages and so on.
(2) Most students live in villages where they face many problems such as signal problems, easyloads.
(3) How can a student of MA learn good knowledge, skills, and experience through online system.
(4) And the online system also cannot give students confidence.
(5) It cannot develope manners and abilities.
(6) It does not teach a student how to behave and face teachers.
(7) And teachers have no experience to deliver a good lecture in online classes.
(8) Online system is nothing more just to lose the eyesight
(9) We don't just need a degree, we want good knowledge and experience.
Sir please take necessary steps. Otherwise there will be a literary disaster which we can't Imagine.
Regards.

Student Reviews & Comments:
In light of the the COVID-19 outbreak and it?s current circumstances, the government has announced the continuation 
of university classes through online means. However, unfortunately, this method of course delivery has been a complete and utter failure. Live streaming an online lecture with more than 30 people at one time requires a strong fiber backed internet connectivity which majority of us students do not possess. We believe, in a country like Pakistan, it is almost impossible to have an internet connection strong enough to stream HD video in real time, and what is being shown to us is a blurred out stream where one can?t even see what?s going on in it. Video delay, lag, and playback buffering make lectures ineffective. The noise and disturbance in signals make the lecturer inaudible, moreover, the lecturers have no control over users, which allows outsiders to join in and further disrupt the classes. All of us have paid hefty sums of money as fees in order to gain quality education, which we currently aren?t receiving, and this is only leading to wastage of time and resources of both, teachers and students. This may adversely affect our GPA?s. A semester break, thus, is a suitable option, while extending dates for final examinations. Classes can be continued when universities reopen as soon as the prevailing issue ebbs down

#poor internet connectivity issue
#online classes effect on studetns grades and gpa

Sir you are just repeating same thing again and again. Many of us don't have proper facilities for the online classes and 
we are unable to understand online lectures and voice notes for the subjects like stats and accounting how we learn something from voice notes. Moreover, some of us are also belong to poor families. Kindly consider our request to end the online classes because it is all just a scam that is making us all believe that we 
are getting good quality education and it is saving our semester but in reality it is not. Even if you give us online lectures we understand nothing and at the end of the day, when the universities open, the teachers would have to give all the lectures again because majority isn't able to take the online lectures and the ones who are taking have no idea what is going on. Upon these online classes now there's a new issue regarding the term paper, now we have to submit an assignment, a sort of research paper instead because we have to cover up the midterm exams in this way, are we a joke to you all, we can't even take online classes how are we supposed to do the term paper amongst so many limitations and restrictions, the major one in which is, unavailability of the internet. It is really nerve wracking for us; the people you call future of the nation. Well you are destroying the future of the nation. Some universities are very well aware of their technical deficiencies but are still forcefully taking online lectures and it has zero positive results. Now amongst all these technical, financial issues we have to constantly worry about not just taking online classes but also thinking how to submit the term paper with minor resources. It's not like the faculty follows the time table, classes are sometimes random and sometimes taken even on days which are off. What are we supposed to do, be on a watch 24/7 that now the class will start. This is callous attitude and ruining not only our grades but also our mental health. Mental health is not a joke, everyone is very well aware of the suicides that students commit because of your beautiful education system. Is it too hard to stop all these useless efforts of online classes till 31st may and let us all get a bit stable and breathe a little? Not even the teachers are comfortable with this system. Do not know what the university authorities are saying but if maximum 37 students are able to take online classes (even they have issues) out of 100 plus students then it's a big problem. And this is the number of one semester only. What did these students do to deserve this, was it their fault that this pandemic broke out and countries had to go under lock down?
Kindly consider our request and end the online classes and term paper system.
Thousands of complaints, infact even more, I don't know what else are you all waiting for, how much more clear we have to be that this system is ruining us, so stop online classes.

To the Prime Minister oF Pakistan #ImranKhan , Chairman of boards, Mian Amir , Vice Chancellor of capital University 
of science and technology with all due respect it is being informed that now a days due to this disease #coronavirus the whole world is facing severe problems and is under the Lockdown. Same is the situation with the Pakistan as HEC has announced that all the institutions will remain closed till 05-04-2020 and with that universities had launched online classes system with Microsoft team.This system of online classes has not been experienced fruitful as students has not good internet services or enough resources to arrange all the things in addition the teachers gave assignments and quiz's without knowing whether the students are clear with the lecture or not .So after one week of launching this program it has been experienced that the online classes system has flopped . Taking note of this HEC has announced that the online classes system will be closed and all the institutions will remain closed till 31st May 2020 and these vocations will be given name as some sort of summer vocations etc. The country is under severe condition of Coronavirus and obviously due to Lockdown the businesses and all other ways of earning are closed. Parents are worried how they will feed their families how they will arrange for university fees.Everything is under lockdown we are not earning even a single rupee so we cannot afford to pay the university. Keeping in mind that when the university started they took the buss fee also the students have not used that service too and they haven't returned that amount to the students. On losing the registration thousands of dreams of parents and students will die keeping in mind we are the youth of pakistan and PRIME MINISTER will be held responsible for this.In this critical condition we want to government to stand by our side . #PrimeMinisterImranKhan #YouthOfPakistan #vicechancellorofcapitaluniversityofscienceandtechnology #Capitaluniversity #cust

Online classes are utterly injustice with Students of villages,Ex Fata Students,poor and even middle class Students.As 
internet is obligatory for Online Classes and it is clear that Ex Fata and many villages have even no network then how students of these areas will be able to attend Online Classes.Secondly,some places have network but a weak internet system as shown in picture.So Students of such areas will have to go outside their homes to get good access of internet.Now let me tell you that if movies and dramas are supposed to be watched in Cinema Halls then how a student can get/understand lecture outdoor,would he not be disturbed by passersby?
Internet required for Online Classes must be more than 20 GB as there will be at least three consecutive classes.Monthly 20 GB internet expenses are about 600 it's mean that every student will have to consume at least 1000 Rupees on internet every month,so, how poor students will afford this? Many students get admission in Govt.Colleges because they can't afford the expensive semester fee of universities.
In a nutshell,decision about Online Classes must be taken unbiasedly.It should not be on the basis of QAU or Numul,Islamabad or Lahore but Students of areas deprived of network and internet be chiefly concerned.
-LohaNi
-GC1(D.I.Khan)-ISF President

*: Khalil Ilias, student of BS Sociology.*
*The major problems are following.*
*1. Unpleasure environment at home.*
Most of students belongs to joint families and their is too noise at their homes, rooms.
Parents also disturb students in their home works.
*2. Network unavailability.*
Some students belong to such areas that there is no think about network facility such as kacho.
*3. Slow network spead*
Most of students belong to rural areas and their is 2G network that is unsufficient for live class.
*4. Expensive Internet Packages.*
Students who are belongs to poor family or labor class. Their parants has unemployeed due to lockdown, so they can not afford to expensive packages.
*5. Problems during live Class.*
During live classes not only students but teachers also face several problems such as, network connection break, Audio noise problem, low display quality, Noise at home, whats app or other notifications slide up on the screen.
*6. Limited numbers of participant.*
Only 100 people can join a meating at a time and the enrollment of most classes is above 100, so all student can not join.
*7. Unmatched decipline.*
Most of students belongs to diciplines where study is based on practicals and live experience work, such as medical fields.
*8. Unintelligible class.*

To, 
The vice chancellor;
Jinnah university for women karachi.
Assalamualikum,
Respected sir;
As,the deliverance of current procedure of online examination by our university,we felt deeply about our examination system as it is not possible to conduct exams over lms 
There are many issues that can put us in difficulty:
Firstly, lms have their own server issues because while we are conducted online classes during this process we can't take online classes properly & when we open lms most of the time it was hanged so because of this we can't take proper online class and we aren't  guaranteed about the smooth run up of our online exams, interruption may cause failure to our examination.
Secondly, the lectures weren't sufficient for our understandings and were not as according to our classroom environment so, we are having problems in developing  our concepts regarding it by just reading the word document or attending forums. 
Lastly, there are many personal issues with many of the students, some don't have laptop facility while other have loading shedding & networking issues.so, it may cause a huge hurdle if we support this online examination. Our grades will be affected & moreover we won't be able to appear online. We want our university to promote us to our new session as per as previous grades or GPA. 
Thankyou!

Higher Education Commission (HEC) is under the order of our government, not only the schools and colleges are going through this pandemic situation, university students are facing the same issues. Online classes might be effective for the minor student community but the major portion is going through a lot of trouble, approximately 30% are understanding and learning through this online teaching process rest 70% is unsatisfied and in trouble. Now where the students are not even sure about the knowledge gathered through online sessions HEC has decided to arrange examinations (either online or sitting exams) when we are not prepared without even concerning our issues, how can someone attempt the exams without learning. Is it all about taking exams and huge fees from the students? Majority of the portion is on scholarship who will assure to pay their fee when they can?t maintain their grades? Moreover it?s not just about a semester, fee or scholarship it is about their career. How can HEC risk our career? Is there nobody to raise voice for us?  
We have signed various petition regarding no online classes and no exams for university students but no one bothered about it now we want media to draw government?s attention toward us. 
We demand to be promoted to next semester either on the basis of previous result or the upcoming semesters result after the COVID-19 .
WE DEMAND NO EXAMINATION FOR UNIVERSITY STUDENT TILL THIS COVID-19 OR PROPER REGULAR CLASSES.
Save our result save our career.
      RAISE VOICE FOR YOURSELVES!

Student Reviews & Comments:
1.Internet issue:

Mostly students are from backward areas that enjoy only 2G. Boys can go to outside to get 3G but what about girls?
Boys go outside, but there is no facilities in villages. A lot of noice, bad thinkings about the students about usage of mobile in our society disturbs the students.
Whats about battery of mobile phone while attending continuously 2,3 lectures for the students outside the village? 

2.Resources
Mostly students are from backward areas and belongs to middle class families, that have no such resources to buy mobile phones & laptops as well.So, students cannot attend classes.

3.Burden
There are too many lectures in a week (24 lec) with Saturday off. Why?
It's the month of Ramadan, month of more worship for muslims, the holy month. What you thik about Ramadan?
If we listen lectures, prepare or write them?
4 lectures in a day out of which 3 are continues. And most burden of assignments.

4.Health Disorders
Students body is also a human body! What you think about students health? 
Listening lectures or attending classes continuously using headphones disturb hearing of the body, and also damage mental rest and causes headache. 
Doctors said that continuously using mobile ?? phone is harmful to human body that's 100% true. What you think about eyesight problems of students. I hope if you continue online classes you will see 1 person out of 3 that will be the patient of eyesight, whose complete responsible will be our University. What you think about distancing of students from 'worship during Ramadan','Family members'?

5.Lecture issue
Some lectures also have voice issues.Some slides voice format is not supported by mostly mobiles. Its also a side effect of slides study that if a slide have audio of 5 minutes we cannot start fron 2nd minute, if we have some confusion in a slide then we have to start listening from beginning that losses our intention to study and causes disheartening. During lectures our phone run out of internet, after this we often not able to join the class. What's about data packages?
For notification ?? of announcements from teachers we have to check Google classroom again and again that's not a good thing during study and in the internet problems.

HEC itself is not sure how to cope with the situation. It seems as if HEC's information source is twitter, where students
 are tweeting whatever they are being fed by the their team heads on daily basis. Students have internet for whatsapp, twitter and facebook, but not for the educational purposes. What is more startling and disastrous is that HEC is actually believing whatever is being said on social media ignoring the fact that students are using internet for social media meaning thereby they have access to stable internet per se. HEC fails to understand the underlying premise of these trends on social media. This is not a country where students love to study, its a place where students are only interested in extracurricular activities and nothing more. Students whose many years have been wasted due to various reasons are more worried than ever, some are in their final years to apply for any further education or jobs, and this delay is fatal for them. Students who are in their final semester and have attempted their mid exams are only waiting for their finals. No definite policy nor any plan has been announced by HEC for universities and students thereof. Internet was never the problem, but the will of HEC is and always was. Govt universities never cared about students or anything else, private universities only care about money. No one is concerned about the so called future of country (the students).
